body_html: @ht93 if it's a nearest mode then fortunately there's an easy workaround for now - use unsqueeze and pretend that your input is 2D (with e.g. height of 1), use UpsamplingNearest2d, and then slice off a single row (all rows should be the same).
body_text: @ht93 if it's a nearest mode then fortunately there's an easy workaround for now - use unsqueeze and pretend that your input is 2D (with e.g. height of 1), use UpsamplingNearest2d, and then slice off a single row (all rows should be the same).
body: @ht93 if it's a nearest mode then fortunately there's an easy workaround for now - use `unsqueeze` and pretend that your input is 2D (with e.g. height of 1), use `UpsamplingNearest2d`, and then slice off a single row (all rows should be the same).
